verses.text: and thou hast eaten before Jehovah thy God, in the place where He doth choose to cause His name to tabernacle, the tithe of thy corn, of thy new wine, and of thine oil, and the firstlings of thy herd, and of thy flock, so that thou dost learn to fear Jehovah thy God all the days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when the way is too much for thee, that thou art not able to carry it -- when the place is too far off from thee which Jehovah thy God doth choose to put His name there, when Jehovah thy God doth bless thee; --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then thou hast given [it] in money, and hast bound up the money in thy hand, and gone unto the place on which Jehovah thy God doth fix;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast given the money for any thing which thy soul desireth, for oxen, and for sheep, and for wine, and for strong drink, and for any thing which thy soul asketh, and thou hast eaten there before Jehovah thy God, and thou hast rejoiced, thou and thy house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As to the Levite who [is] within thy gates, thou dost not forsake him, for he hath no portion and inheritance with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `At the end of three years thou dost bring out all the tithe of thine increase in that year, and hast placed [it] within thy gates;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and come in hath the Levite (for he hath no part and inheritance with thee), and the sojourner, and the fatherless, and the widow, who [are] within thy gates, and they have eaten, and been satisfied, so that Jehovah thy God doth bless thee in all the work of thy hand which thou dost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `At the end of seven years thou dost make a release,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this [is] the matter of the release: Every owner of a loan [is] to release his hand which he doth lift up against his neighbour, he doth not exact of his neighbour and of his brother, but hath proclaimed a release to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the stranger thou mayest exact, and that which is thine with thy brother doth thy hand release;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: only when there is no needy one with thee, for Jehovah doth greatly bless thee in the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee -- an inheritance to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only, if thou dost diligently hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all this command which I am commanding thee to-day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Jehovah thy God hath blessed thee as He hath spoken to thee; and thou hast lent [to] many nations, and thou hast not borrowed; and thou hast ruled over many nations, and over thee they do not rule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When there is with thee any needy one of one of thy brethren, in one of thy cities, in thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, thou dost not harden thy heart, nor shut thy hand from thy needy brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for thou dost certainly open thy hand to him, and dost certainly lend him sufficient for his lack which he lacketh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Take heed to thee lest there be a word in thy heart -- worthless, saying, Near [is] the seventh year, the year of release; and thine eye is evil against thy needy brother, and thou dost not give to him, and he hath called concerning thee unto Jehovah, and it hath been in thee sin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou dost certainly give to him, and thy heart is not sad in thy giving to him, for because of this thing doth Jehovah thy God bless thee in all thy works, and in every putting forth of thy hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the needy one doth not cease out of the land, therefore I am commanding thee, saying, Thou dost certainly open thy hand to thy brother, to thy poor, and to thy needy one, in thy land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thy brother is sold to thee, a Hebrew or a Hebrewess, and he hath served thee six years -- then in the seventh year thou dost send him away free from thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when thou dost send him away free from thee, thou dost not send him away empty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou dost certainly encircle him out of thy flock, and out of thy threshing-floor, and out of thy wine-vat; [of] that which Jehovah thy God hath blessed thee thou dost give to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast remembered that a servant thou hast been in the land of Egypt, and Jehovah thy God doth ransom thee; therefore I am commanding thee this thing to-day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, when he saith unto thee, I go not out from thee -- because he hath loved thee, and thy house, because [it is] good for him with thee --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then thou hast taken the awl, and hast put [it] through his ear, and through the door, and he hath been to thee a servant age-during; and also to thy handmaid thou dost do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `It is not hard in thine eyes, in thy sending him away free from thee; for the double of the hire of an hireling he hath served thee six years, and Jehovah thy God hath blessed thee in all that thou dost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Every firstling that is born in thy herd and in thy flock -- the male thou dost sanctify to Jehovah thy God; thou dost not work with the firstling of thine ox, nor shear the firstling of thy flock;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: before Jehovah thy God thou dost eat it year by year, in the place which Jehovah doth choose, thou and thy house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when there is in it a blemish, lame, or blind, any evil blemish, thou dost not sacrifice it to Jehovah thy God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: within thy gates thou dost eat it, the unclean and the clean alike, as the roe, and as the hart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only, its blood thou dost not eat; on the earth thou dost pour it as water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Observe the month of Abib -- and thou hast made a passover to Jehovah thy God, for in the month of Abib hath Jehovah thy God brought thee out of Egypt by night;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast sacrificed a passover to Jehovah thy God, of the flock, and of the herd, in the place which Jehovah doth choose to cause His name to tabernacle there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not eat with it any fermented thing, seven days thou dost eat with it unleavened things, bread of affliction; for in haste thou hast come out of the land of Egypt; so that thou dost remember the day of thy coming out of the land of Egypt all days of thy life;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there is not seen with thee leaven in all thy border seven days, and there doth not remain of the flesh which thou dost sacrifice at evening on the first day till morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou art not able to sacrifice the passover within any of thy gates which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except at the place which Jehovah thy God doth choose to cause His name to tabernacle -- there thou dost sacrifice the passover in the evening, at the going in of the sun, the season of thy coming out of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast cooked and eaten in the place on which Jehovah thy God doth fix, and hast turned in the morning, and gone to thy tents;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six days thou dost eat unleavened things, and on the seventh day [is] a restraint to Jehovah thy God; thou dost do no work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Seven weeks thou dost number to thee; from the beginning of the sickle among the standing corn thou dost begin to number seven weeks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made the feast of weeks to Jehovah thy God, a tribute of a free-will offering of thy hand, which thou dost give, as Jehovah thy God doth bless thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou hast rejoiced before Jehovah thy God, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy man-servant, and thy handmaid, and the Levite who [is] within thy gates, and the sojourner, and the fatherless, and the widow, who [are] in thy midst, in the place which Jehovah thy God doth choose to cause His name to tabernacle there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast remembered that a servant thou hast been in Egypt, and hast observed and done these statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The feast of booths thou dost make for thee seven days, in thine in-gathering of thy threshing-floor, and of thy wine-vat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast rejoiced in thy feast, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy man-servant, and thy handmaid, and the Levite, and the sojourner, and the fatherless, and the widow, who [are] within thy gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days thou dost feast before Jehovah thy God, in the place which Jehovah doth choose, for Jehovah thy God doth bless thee in all thine increase, and in every work of thy hands, and thou hast been only rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Three times in a year doth every one of thy males appear before Jehovah thy God in the place which He doth choose -- in the feast of unleavened things, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of booths; and they do not appear before Jehovah empty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: each according to the gift of his hand, according to the blessing of Jehovah thy God, which He hath given to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Judges and authorities thou dost make to thee within all thy gates which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, for thy tribes; and they have judged the people -- a righteous judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou dost not turn aside judgment; thou dost not discern faces, nor take a bribe, for the bribe blindeth the eyes of the wise, and perverteth the words of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteousness -- righteousness thou dost pursue, so that thou livest, and hast possessed the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not plant for thee a shrine of any trees near the altar of Jehovah thy God, which thou makest for thyself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou dost not raise up to thee any standing image which Jehovah thy God is hating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not sacrifice to Jehovah thy God ox or sheep in which there is a blemish -- any evil thing; for it [is] the abomination of Jehovah thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When there is found in thy midst, in one of thy cities which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, a man or a woman who doth the evil thing in the eyes of Jehovah thy God by transgressing His covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he doth go and serve other gods, and doth bow himself to them, and to the sun, or to the moon, or to any of the host of the heavens, which I have not commanded --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been declared to thee, and thou hast heard, and hast searched diligently, and lo, truth; the thing is established; this abomination hath been done in Israel --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Then thou hast brought out that man, or that woman, who hath done this evil thing, unto thy gates -- the man or the woman -- and thou hast stoned them with stones, and they have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the mouth of two witnesses or of three witnesses is he who is dead put to death; he is not put to death by the mouth of one witness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hand of the witnesses is on him, in the first place, to put him to death, and the hand of all the people last; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When anything is too hard for thee for judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke -- matters of strife within thy gates -- then thou hast risen, and gone up unto the place on which Jehovah thy God doth fix,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast come in unto the priests, the Levites, and unto the judge who is in those days, and hast inquired, and they have declared to thee the word of judgment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast done according to the tenor of the word which they declare to thee ([they] of that place which Jehovah doth choose; and thou hast observed to do according to all that they direct thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `According to the tenor of the law which they direct thee, and according to the judgment which they say to thee thou dost do; thou dost not turn aside from the word which they declare to thee, right or left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man who acteth with presumption, so as not to hearken unto the priest (who is standing to serve there Jehovah thy God), or unto the judge, even that man hath died, and thou hast put away the evil thing from Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the people do hear and fear, and do not presume any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou comest in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, and hast possessed it, and dwelt in it, and thou hast said, Let me set over me a king like all the nations which [are] round about me, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou dost certainly set over thee a king on whom Jehovah doth fix; from the midst of thy brethren thou dost set over thee a king; thou art not able to set over thee a stranger, who is not thy brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only, he doth not multiply to himself horses, nor cause the people to turn back to Egypt, so as to multiply horses, seeing Jehovah hath said to you, Ye do not add to turn back in this way any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he doth not multiply to himself wives, and his heart doth not turn aside, and silver and gold he doth not multiply to himself -- exceedingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, when he sitteth on the throne of his kingdom, that he hath written for himself the copy of this law, on a book, from [that] before the priests the Levites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been with him, and he hath read in it all days of his life, so that he doth learn to fear Jehovah his God, to keep all the words of this law, and these statutes, to do them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that his heart is not high above his brethren, and so as not to turn aside from the command, right or left, so that he prolongeth days over his kingdom, he and his sons, in the midst of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `There is not to the priests the Levites -- all the tribe of Levi -- a portion and inheritance with Israel; fire-offerings of Jehovah, even His inheritance, they eat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he hath no inheritance in the midst of his brethren; Jehovah Himself [is] his inheritance, as He hath spoken to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this is the priest's right from the people, from those sacrificing a sacrifice, whether ox or sheep, he hath even given to the priest the leg, and the two cheeks, and the stomach;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the first of thy corn, of thy new wine, and of thine oil, and the first of the fleece of thy flock, thou dost give to him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for on him hath Jehovah thy God fixed, out of all thy tribes, to stand to serve in the name of Jehovah, He and his sons continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when the Levite cometh from one of thy cities out of all Israel, where he hath sojourned, and hath come with all the desire of his soul unto the place which Jehovah doth choose,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he hath ministered in the name of Jehovah his God, like all his brethren, the Levites, who are standing there before Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: portion as portion they do eat, apart from his sold things, with the fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou art coming in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, thou dost not learn to do according to the abominations of those nations:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: there is not found in thee one causing his son and his daughter to pass over into fire, a user of divinations, an observer of clouds, and an enchanter, and a sorcerer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a charmer, and one asking at a familiar spirit, and a wizard, and one seeking unto the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For the abomination of Jehovah [is] every one doing these, and because of these abominations is Jehovah thy God dispossessing them from thy presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perfect thou art with Jehovah thy God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for these nations whom thou art possessing, unto observers of clouds, and unto diviners, do hearken; and thou -- not so hath Jehovah thy God suffered thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `A prophet out of thy midst, out of thy brethren, like to me, doth Jehovah thy God raise up to thee -- unto him ye hearken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to all that thou didst ask from Jehovah thy God, in Horeb, in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not add to hear the voice of Jehovah my God, and this great fire let me not see any more, and I die not;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah saith unto me, They have done well that they have spoken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a prophet I raise up to them, out of the midst of their brethren, like to thee; and I have given my words in his mouth, and he hath spoken unto them all that which I command him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been -- the man who doth not hearken unto My words which he doth speak in My name, I require [it] of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only, the prophet who presumeth to speak a word in My name -- that which I have not commanded him to speak -- and who speaketh in the name of other gods -- even that prophet hath died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when thou sayest in thy heart, How do we know the word which Jehovah hath not spoken? --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that which the prophet speaketh in the name of Jehovah, and the thing is not, and cometh not -- it [is] the word which Jehovah hath not spoken; in presumption hath the prophet spoken it; -- thou art not afraid of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When Jehovah thy God doth cut off the nations, whose land Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, and thou hast succeeded them, and dwelt in their cities, and in their houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three cities thou dost separate for thee in the midst of thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou dost prepare for thee the way, and hast divided into three parts the border of thy land which Jehovah thy God doth cause thee to inherit, and it hath been for the fleeing thither of every man-slayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this [is] the matter of the man-slayer who fleeth thither, and hath lived: He who smiteth his neighbour unknowingly, and is not hating him heretofore,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even he who cometh in with his neighbour into a forest to hew wood, and his hand hath driven with an axe to cut the tree, and the iron hath slipped from the wood, and hath met his neighbour, and he hath died -- he doth flee unto one of these cities, and hath lived,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest the redeemer of blood pursue after the man-slayer when his heart is hot, and hath overtaken him (because the way is great), and hath smitten him -- the life, and he hath no sentence of death, for he is not hating him heretofore;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore I am commanding thee, saying, Three cities thou dost separate to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if Jehovah thy God doth enlarge thy border, as He hath sworn to thy fathers, and hath given to thee all the land which He hath spoken to give to thy fathers --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when thou keepest all this command to do it, which I am commanding thee to-day, to love Jehovah thy God, and to walk in His ways all the days -- then thou hast added to thee yet three cities to these three;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and innocent blood is not shed in the midst of thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee -- an inheritance, and there hath been upon thee blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man is hating his neighbour, and hath lain in wait for him, and risen against him, and smitten him -- the life, and he hath died, and he hath fled unto one of these cities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the elders of his city have sent and taken him from thence, and given him into the hand of the redeemer of blood, and he hath died;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thine eye hath no pity on him, and thou hast put away the innocent blood from Israel, and it is well with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not remove a border of thy neighbour, which they of former times have made, in thine inheritance, which thou dost inherit in the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `One witness doth not rise against a man for any iniquity, and for any sin, in any sin which he sinneth; by the mouth of two witnesses, or by the mouth of three witnesses, is a thing established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a violent witness doth rise against a man, to testify against him apostacy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then have both the men who have the strife stood before Jehovah, before the priests and the judges who are in those days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the judges have searched diligently, and lo, the witness [is] a false witness, a falsehood he hath testified against his brother:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Then ye have done to him as he devised to do to his brother, and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and those who are left do hear and fear, and add not to do any more according to this evil thing in thy midst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thine eye doth not pity -- life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou goest out to battle against thine enemy, and hast seen horse and chariot -- a people more numerous than thou -- thou art not afraid of them, for Jehovah thy God [is] with thee, who is bringing thee up out of the land of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been, in your drawing near unto the battle, that the priest hath come nigh, and spoken unto the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto them, Hear, Israel, ye are drawing near to-day to battle against your enemies, let not your hearts be tender, fear not, nor make haste, nor be terrified at their presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Jehovah your God [is] He who is going with you, to fight for you with your enemies -- to save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the authorities have spoken unto the people, saying, Who [is] the man that hath built a new house, and hath not dedicated it? -- let him go and turn back to his house, lest he die in battle, and another man dedicate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And who [is] the man that hath planted a vineyard, and hath not made it common? -- let him go and turn back to his house, lest he die in battle, and another man make it common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And who [is] the man that hath betrothed a woman, and hath not taken her? -- let him go and turn back to his house, lest he die in battle, and another man take her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the authorities have added to speak unto the people, and said, Who [is] the man that is afraid and tender of heart? -- let him go and turn back to his house, and the heart of his brethren doth not melt like his heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath come to pass as the authorities finish to speak unto the people, that they have appointed princes of the hosts at the head of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou drawest near unto a city to fight against it, then thou hast called unto it for Peace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been, if Peace it answer thee, and hath opened to thee, then it hath come to pass -- all the people who are found in it are to thee for tributaries, and have served thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if it doth not make peace with thee, and hath made with thee war, then thou hast laid siege against it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah thy God hath given it into thy hand, and thou hast smitten every male of it by the mouth of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only, the women, and the infants, and the cattle, and all that is in the city, all its spoil, thou dost seize for thyself, and thou hast eaten the spoil of thine enemies which Jehovah thy God hath given to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So thou dost do to all the cities which are very far off from thee, which are not of the cities of these nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Only, of the cities of these peoples which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee [for] an inheritance, thou dost not keep alive any breathing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for thou dost certainly devote the Hittite, and the Amorite, the Canaanite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, as Jehovah thy God hath commanded thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they teach you not to do according to all their abominations which they have done to their gods, and ye have sinned against Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou layest siege unto a city many days, to fight against it, to capture it, thou dost not destroy its trees to force an axe against them, for of them thou dost eat, and them thou dost not cut down -- for man's [is] the tree of the field -- to go in at thy presence in the siege.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only, the tree, which thou knowest that it [is] not a fruit-tree, it thou dost destroy, and hast cut down, and hast built a bulwark against the city which is making with thee war till thou hast subdued it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When one is found slain on the ground which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee to possess it -- fallen in a field -- it is not known who hath smitten him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then have thine elders and thy judges gone out and measured unto the cities which [are] round about the slain one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been, the city which [is] near unto the slain one, even the elders of that city have taken a heifer of the herd, which hath not been wrought with, which hath not drawn in the yoke,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the elders of that city have brought down the heifer unto a hard valley, which is not tilled nor sown, and have beheaded there the heifer in the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the priests, sons of Levi, have come nigh -- for on them hath Jehovah thy God fixed to serve Him, and to bless in the name of Jehovah, and by their mouth is every strife, and every stroke --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the elders of that city, who are near unto the slain one, do wash their hands over the heifer which is beheaded in the valley,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have answered and said, Our hands have not shed this blood, and our eyes have not seen --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: receive atonement for Thy people Israel, whom Thou hast ransomed, O Jehovah, and suffer not innocent blood in the midst of Thy people Israel; and the blood hath been pardoned to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou dost put away the innocent blood out of thy midst, for thou dost that which [is] right in the eyes of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou goest out to battle against thine enemies, and Jehovah thy God hath given them into thy hand, and thou hast taken captive its captivity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast seen in the captivity a woman of fair form, and hast delighted in her, and hast taken to thee for a wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then thou hast brought her in unto the midst of thy household, and she hath shaved her head, and prepared her nails,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and turned aside the raiment of her captivity from off her, and hath dwelt in thy house, and bewailed her father and her mother a month of days, and afterwards thou dost go in unto her and hast married her, and she hath been to thee for a wife:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been -- if thou hast not delighted in her, that thou hast sent her away at her desire, and thou dost not at all sell her for money; thou dost not tyrannize over her, because that thou hast humbled her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man hath two wives, the one loved and the other hated, and they have borne to him sons (the loved one and the hated one), and the first-born son hath been to the hated one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it hath been, in the day of his causing his sons to inherit that which he hath, he is not able to declare first-born the son of the loved one, in the face of the son of the hated one -- the first-born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the first-born, son of the hated one, he doth acknowledge, to give to him a double portion of all that is found with him, for he [is] the beginning of his strength; to him [is] the right of the first-born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man hath a son apostatizing and rebellious -- he is not hearkening to the voice of his father, and to the voice of his mother, and they have chastised him, and he doth not hearken unto them --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then laid hold on him have his father and his mother, and they have brought him out unto the elders of his city, and unto the gate of his place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have said unto the elders of his city, Our son -- this one -- is apostatizing and rebellious; he is not hearkening to our voice -- a glutton and drunkard;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the men of his city have stoned him with stones, and he hath died, and thou hast put away the evil out of thy midst, and all Israel do hear and fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when there is in a man a sin -- a cause of death, and he hath been put to death, and thou hast hanged him on a tree,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his corpse doth not remain on the tree, for thou dost certainly bury him in that day -- for a thing lightly esteemed of God [is] the hanged one -- and thou dost not defile thy ground which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee -- an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not see the ox of thy brother or his sheep driven away, and hast hidden thyself from them, thou dost certainly turn them back to thy brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if thy brother [is] not near unto thee, and thou hast not known him, then thou hast removed it unto the midst of thy house, and it hath been with thee till thy brother seek it, and thou hast given it back to him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so thou dost to his ass, and so thou dost to his garment, and so thou dost to any lost thing of thy brother's, which is lost by him, and thou hast found it; thou art not able to hide thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not see the ass of thy brother, or his ox, falling in the way, and hast hid thyself from them; thou dost certainly raise [them] up with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The habiliments of a man are not on a woman, nor doth a man put on the garment of a woman, for the abomination of Jehovah thy God [is] any one doing these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a bird's nest cometh before thee in the way, in any tree, or on the earth, brood or eggs, and the mother sitting on the brood or on the eggs, thou dost not take the mother with the young ones;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou dost certainly send away the mother, and the young ones dost take to thyself, so that it is well with thee, and thou hast prolonged days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou buildest a new house, then thou hast made a parapet to thy roof, and thou dost not put blood on thy house when one falleth from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not sow thy vineyard [with] divers things, lest the fulness of the seed which thou dost sow, and the increase of the vineyard, be separated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not plow with an ox and with an ass together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not put on a mixed cloth, wool and linen together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Fringes thou dost make to thee on the four skirts of thy covering with which thou dost cover [thyself].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man taketh a wife, and hath gone in unto her, and hated her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and laid against her actions of words, and brought out against her an evil name, and said, This woman I have taken, and I draw near unto her, and I have not found in her tokens of virginity:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Then hath the father of the damsel -- and her mother -- taken and brought out the tokens of virginity of the damsel unto the elders of the city in the gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the father of the damsel hath said unto the elders, My daughter I have given to this man for a wife, and he doth hate her;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lo, he hath laid actions of words, saying, I have not found to thy daughter tokens of virginity -- and these [are] the tokens of the virginity of my daughter! and they have spread out the garment before the elders of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the elders of that city have taken the man, and chastise him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and fined him a hundred silverlings, and given to the father of the damsel, because he hath brought out an evil name on a virgin of Israel, and she is to him for a wife, he is not able to send her away all his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if this thing hath been truth -- tokens of virginity have not been found for the damsel --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then they have brought out the damsel unto the opening of her father's house, and stoned her have the men of her city with stones, and she hath died, for she hath done folly in Israel, to go a-whoring [in] her father's house; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man is found lying with a woman, married to a husband, then they have died even both of them, the man who is lying with the woman, also the woman; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When there is a damsel, a virgin, betrothed to a man, and a man hath found her in a city, and lain with her;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then ye have brought them both out unto the gate of that city, and stoned them with stones, and they have died: -- the damsel, because that she hath not cried, [being] in a city; and the man, because that he hath humbled his neighbour's wife; and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if in a field the man find the damsel who is betrothed, and the man hath laid hold on her, and lain with her, then hath the man who hath lain with her died alone;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to the damsel thou dost not do anything, the damsel hath no deadly sin; for as a man riseth against his neighbour and hath murdered him -- the life, so [is] this thing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in a field he found her, she hath cried -- the damsel who is betrothed -- and she hath no saviour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man findeth a damsel, a virgin who is not betrothed, and hath caught her, and lain with her, and they have been found,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath the man who is lying with her given to the father of the damsel fifty silverlings, and to him she is for a wife; because that he hath humbled her, he is not able to send her away all his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `A man doth not take his father's wife, nor uncover his father's skirt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `One wounded, bruised, or cut in the member doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a bastard doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of him doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `An Ammonite and a Moabite doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even a tenth generation of them doth not enter into the assembly of Jehovah -- to the age;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because that they have not come before you with bread and with water in the way, in your coming out from Egypt, and because he hath hired against thee Balaam son of Beor, of Pethor of Aram-Naharaim, to revile thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah thy God hath not been willing to hearken unto Balaam, and Jehovah thy God doth turn for thee the reviling to a blessing, because Jehovah thy God hath loved thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou dost not seek their peace and their good all thy days -- to the age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not abominate an Edomite, for thy brother he [is]; thou dost not abominate an Egyptian, for a sojourner thou hast been in his land;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sons who are begotten of them, a third generation of them, doth enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a camp goeth out against thine enemies, then thou hast kept from every evil thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When there is in thee a man who is not clean, from an accident at night -- then he hath gone out unto the outside of the camp -- he doth not come in unto the midst of the camp --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been, at the turning of the evening, he doth bathe with water, and at the going in of the sun he doth come in unto the midst of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a station thou hast at the outside of the camp, and thou hast gone out thither without,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a nail thou hast on thy staff, and it hath been, in thy sitting without, that thou hast digged with it, and turned back, and covered thy filth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Jehovah thy God is walking up and down in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee, and to give thine enemies before thee, and thy camp hath been holy, and He doth not see in thee the nakedness of anything, and hath turned back from after thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not shut up a servant unto his lord, who is delivered unto thee from his lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with thee he doth dwell, in thy midst, in the place which he chooseth within one of thy gates, where it is pleasing to him; thou dost not oppress him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `There is not a whore among the daughters of Israel, nor is there a whoremonger among the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou dost not bring a gift of a whore, or a price of a dog, into the house of Jehovah thy God, for any vow; for the abomination of Jehovah thy God [are] even both of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not lend in usury to thy brother; usury of money, usury of food, usury of anything which is lent on usury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To a stranger thou mayest lend in usury, and to thy brother thou dost not lend in usury, so that Jehovah thy God doth bless thee in every putting forth of thy hand on the land whither thou goest in to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou vowest a vow to Jehovah thy God, thou dost not delay to complete it; for Jehovah thy God doth certainly require it from thee, and it hath been in thee -- sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when thou forbearest to vow, it is not in thee a sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The produce of thy lips thou dost keep, and hast done [it], as thou hast vowed to Jehovah thy God; a free-will-offering, which thou hast spoken with thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou comest in unto the vineyard of thy neighbour, then thou hast eaten grapes, according to thy desire, thy sufficiency; but into thy vessel thou dost not put [any].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When thou comest in among the standing-corn of thy neighbour, then thou hast plucked the ears with thy hand, but a sickle thou dost not wave over the standing-corn of thy neighbour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man doth take a wife, and hath married her, and it hath been, if she doth not find grace in his eyes (for he hath found in her nakedness of anything), and he hath written for her a writing of divorce, and given [it] into her hand, and sent her out of his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she hath gone out of his house, and hath gone and been another man's,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the latter man hath hated her, and written for her a writing of divorce, and given [it] into her hand, and sent her out of his house, or when the latter man dieth, who hath taken her to himself for a wife:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Her former husband who sent her away is not able to turn back to take her to be to him for a wife, after that she hath become defiled; for an abomination it [is] before Jehovah, and thou dost not cause the land to sin which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee -- an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man taketh a new wife, he doth not go out into the host, and [one] doth not pass over unto him for anything; free he is at his own house one year, and hath rejoiced his wife whom he hath taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `None doth take in pledge millstones, and rider, for life it [is] he is taking in pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man is found stealing a person, of his brethren, of the sons of Israel, and hath tyrannized over him, and sold him, then hath that thief died, and thou hast put away the evil thing out of thy midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Take heed, in the plague of leprosy, to watch greatly, and to do according to all that the priests, the Levites, teach you; as I have commanded them ye observe to do;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: remember that which Jehovah thy God hath done to Miriam in the way, in your coming out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou liftest up on thy brother a debt of anything, thou dost not go in unto his house to obtain his pledge;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at the outside thou dost stand, and the man on whom thou art lifting [it] up is bringing out unto thee the pledge at the outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if he is a poor man, thou dost not lie down with his pledge;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou dost certainly give back to him the pledge at the going in of the sun, and he hath lain down in his own raiment, and hath blessed thee; and to thee it is righteousness before Jehovah thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not oppress a hireling, poor and needy, of thy brethren or of thy sojourner who is in thy land within thy gates;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in his day thou dost give his hire, and the sun doth not go in upon it, for he [is] poor, and unto it he is lifting up his soul, and he doth not cry against thee unto Jehovah, and it hath been in thee -- sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Fathers are not put to death for sons, and sons are not put to death for fathers -- each for his own sin, they are put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not turn aside the judgment of a fatherless sojourner, nor take in pledge the garment of a widow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast remembered that a servant thou hast been in Egypt, and Jehovah thy God doth ransom thee from thence; therefore I am commanding thee to do this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou reapest thy harvest in thy field, and hast forgotten a sheaf in a field, thou dost not turn back to take it; to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, it is; so that Jehovah thy God doth bless thee in all the work of thy hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou beatest thine olive, thou dost not examine the branch behind thee; to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, it is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou cuttest thy vineyard, thou dost not glean behind thee; to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, it is;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast remembered that a servant thou hast been in the land of Egypt; therefore I am commanding thee to do this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When there is a strife between men, and they have come nigh unto the judgment, and they have judged, and declared righteous the righteous, and declared wrong the wrong-doer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it hath come to pass, if the wrong-doer is to be smitten, that the judge hath caused him to fall down, and [one] hath smitten him in his presence, according to the sufficiency of his wrong-doing, by number;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: forty [times] he doth smite him -- he is not adding, lest, he is adding to smite him above these -- many stripes, and thy brother is lightly esteemed in thine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not muzzle an ox in its threshing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When brethren dwell together, and one of them hath died, and hath no son, the wife of the dead is not without to a strange man; her husband's brother doth go in unto her, and hath taken her to him for a wife, and doth perform the duty of her husband's brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been, the first-born which she beareth doth rise for the name of his dead brother, and his name is not wiped away out of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the man doth not delight to take his brother's wife, then hath his brother's wife gone up to the gate, unto the elders, and said, My husband's brother is refusing to raise up to his brother a name in Israel; he hath not been willing to perform the duty of my husband's brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the elders of his city have called for him, and spoken unto him, and he hath stood and said, I have no desire to take her;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Then hath his brother's wife drawn nigh unto him, before the eyes of the elders, and drawn his shoe from off his foot, and spat in his face, and answered and said, Thus it is done to the man who doth not build up the house of his brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his name hath been called in Israel -- The house of him whose shoe is drawn off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When men strive together, one with another, and the wife of the one hath drawn near to deliver her husband out of the hand of his smiter, and hath put forth her hand, and laid hold on his secrets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then thou hast cut off her hand, thine eye doth not spare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou hast not in thy bag a stone and a stone, a great and a small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast not in thy house an ephah and an ephah, a great and a small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast a stone complete and just, thou hast an ephah complete and just, so that they prolong thy days on the ground which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the abomination of Jehovah thy God [is] any one doing these things, any one doing iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Remember that which Amalek hath done to thee in the way, in your going out from Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he hath met thee in the way, and smiteth in all those feeble behind thee (and thou wearied and fatigued), and is not fearing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it hath been, in Jehovah thy God's giving rest to thee, from all thine enemies round about, in the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee -- an inheritance to possess it -- thou dost blot out the rememberance of Amalek from under the heavens -- thou dost not forget.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, when thou comest in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee -- an inheritance, and thou hast possessed it, and dwelt in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou hast taken of the first of all the fruits of the ground which thou dost bring in out of thy land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, and hast put [it] in a basket, and gone unto the place which Jehovah thy God doth choose to cause His name to tabernacle there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast come in unto the priest who is in those days, and hast said unto him, I have declared to-day to Jehovah thy God, that I have come in unto the land which Jehovah hath sworn to our fathers to give to us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest hath taken the basket out of thy hand, and placed it before the altar of Jehovah thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast answered and said before Jehovah thy God, A perishing Aramaean [is] my father! and he goeth down to Egypt, and sojourneth there with few men, and becometh there a nation, great, mighty, and numerous;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Egyptians do us evil, and afflict us, and put on us hard service;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we cry unto Jehovah, God of our fathers, and Jehovah heareth our voice, and seeth our affliction, and our labour, and our oppression;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah bringeth us out from Egypt, by a strong hand, and by a stretched-out arm, and by great fear, and by signs, and by wonders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he bringeth us in unto this place, and giveth to us this land -- a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, lo, I have brought in the first of the fruits of the ground which thou hast given to me, O Jehovah; -- and thou hast placed it before Jehovah thy God, and bowed thyself before Jehovah thy God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rejoiced in all the good which Jehovah thy God hath given to thee, and to thy house, thou, and the Levite, and the sojourner who [is] in thy midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou dost complete to tithe all the tithe of thine increase in the third year, the year of the tithe, then thou hast given to the Levite, to the sojourner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, and they have eaten within thy gates, and been satisfied,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast said before Jehovah thy God, I have put away the separated thing out of the house, and also have given it to the Levite, and to the sojourner, and to the orphan, and to the widow, according to all Thy command which Thou hast commanded me; I have not passed over from Thy commands, nor have I forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not eaten in mine affliction of it, nor have I put away of it for uncleanness, nor have I given of it for the dead; I have hearkened to the voice of Jehovah my God; I have done according to all that Thou hast commanded me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: look from Thy holy habitation, from the heavens, and bless Thy people Israel, and the ground which Thou hast given to us, as Thou hast sworn to our fathers -- a land flowing [with] milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This day Jehovah thy God is commanding thee to do these statutes and judgments; and thou hast hearkened and done them with all thy heart, and with all thy soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah thou hast caused to promise to-day to become thy God, and to walk in His ways, and to keep His statutes, and His commands, and His judgments, and to hearken to His voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Jehovah hath caused thee to promise to-day to become His people, a peculiar treasure, as He hath spoken to thee, and to keep all His commands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so as to make thee uppermost above all the nations whom He hath made for a praise, and for a name, and for beauty, and for thy being a holy people to Jehovah thy God, as He hath spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Moses -- the elders of Israel also -- commandeth the people, saying, Keep all the command which I am commanding you to-day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been, in the day that ye pass over the Jordan unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee, that thou hast raised up for thee great stones, and plaistered them with plaister,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and written on them all the words of this law in thy passing over, so that thou goest in unto the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee -- a land flowing with milk and honey, as Jehovah, God of thy fathers, hath spoken to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, in your passing over the Jordan, ye raise up these stones which I am commanding you to-day, in mount Ebal, and thou hast plaistered them with plaister,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and built there an altar to Jehovah thy God, an altar of stones, thou dost not wave over them iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of complete stones thou buildest the altar of Jehovah thy God, and hast caused to ascend on it burnt-offerings to Jehovah thy God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sacrificed peace-offerings, and eaten there, and rejoiced before Jehovah thy God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and written on the stones all the words of this law, well engraved.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses speaketh -- the priests, the Levites, also -- unto all Israel, saying, `Keep silent, and hear, O Israel, this day thou hast become a people to Jehovah thy God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast hearkened to the voice of Jehovah thy God, and done His commands, and His statutes, which I am commanding thee to-day.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses commandeth the people on that day, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `These do stand, to bless the people, on mount Gerizzim, in your passing over the Jordan: Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Joseph, and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these do stand, for the reviling, on mount Ebal: Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the Levites have answered and said unto every man of Israel -- a loud voice:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] the man who maketh a graven and molten image, the abomination of Jehovah, work of the hands of an artificer, and hath put [it] in a secret place, -- and all the people have answered and said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] He who is making light of his father and his mother, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who is removing his neighbour's border, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who is causing the blind to err in the way, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who is turning aside the judgment of fatherless, sojourner, and widow, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who is lying with his father's wife, for he hath uncovered his father's skirt, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who is lying with any beast, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who is lying with his sister, daughter of his father, or daughter of his mother, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who is lying with his mother-in-law, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who is smiting his neighbour in secret, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who is taking a bribe to smite a person, innocent blood, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] he who doth not establish the words of this law, to do them, -- and all the people have said, Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, if thou dost hearken diligently to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to observe to do all His commands which I am commanding thee to-day, that Jehovah thy God hath made thee uppermost above all the nations of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all these blessings have come upon thee, and overtaken thee, because thou dost hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Blessed [art] thou in the city, and blessed [art] thou in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Blessed [is] the fruit of thy womb, and the fruit of thy ground, and the fruit of thy cattle, increase of thine oxen, and wealth of thy flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Blessed [is] thy basket and thy kneading-trough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Blessed [art] thou in thy coming in, and blessed [art] thou in thy going out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah giveth thine enemies, who are rising up against thee -- smitten before thy face; in one way they come out unto thee, and in seven ways they flee before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah commandeth with thee the blessing in thy storehouses, and in every putting forth of thy hand, and hath blessed thee in the land which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth establish thee to Himself for a holy people, as He hath sworn to thee, when thou keepest the commands of Jehovah thy God, and hast walked in His ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the peoples of the land have seen that the name of Jehovah is called upon thee, and they have been afraid of thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Jehovah hath made thee abundant in good, in the fruit of the womb, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of thy ground, on the ground which Jehovah hath sworn to thy fathers to give to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth open to thee his good treasure -- the heavens -- to give the rain of thy land in its season, and to bless all the work of thy hand, and thou hast lent to many nations, and thou -- thou dost not borrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Jehovah hath given thee for head, and not for tail; and thou hast been only above, and art not beneath, for thou dost hearken unto the commands of Jehovah thy God, which I am commanding thee to-day, to keep and to do,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou dost not turn aside from all the words which I am commanding you to-day -- right or left -- to go after other gods, to serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, if thou dost not hearken unto the voice of Jehovah thy God to observe to do all His commands, and His statutes, which I am commanding thee to-day, that all these revilings have come upon thee, and overtaken thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [art] thou in the city, and cursed [art] thou in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] thy basket and thy kneading-trough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [is] the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy land, increase of thine oxen, and wealth of thy flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Cursed [art] thou in thy coming in, and cursed [art] thou in thy going out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth send on thee the curse, the trouble, and the rebuke, in every putting forth of thy hand which thou dost, till thou art destroyed, and till thou perish hastily, because of the evil of thy doings [by] which thou hast forsaken Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth cause to cleave to thee the pestilence, till He consume thee from off the ground whither thou art going in to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth smite thee with consumption, and with fever, and with inflammation, and with extreme burning, and with sword, and with blasting, and with mildew, and they have pursued thee till thou perish
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thy heavens which [are] over thy head have been brass, and the earth which [is] under thee iron;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah giveth the rain of thy land -- dust and ashes; from the heavens it cometh down on thee till thou art destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah giveth thee smitten before thine enemies; in one way thou goest out unto them, and in seven ways dost flee before them, and thou hast been for a trembling to all kingdoms of the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thy carcase hath been for food to every fowl of the heavens, and to the beast of the earth, and there is none causing trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth smite thee with the ulcer of Egypt, and with emerods, and with scurvy, and with itch, of which thou art not able to be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth smite thee with madness, and with blindness, and with astonishment of heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast been gropling at noon, as the blind gropeth in darkness; and thou dost not cause thy ways to prosper; and thou hast been only oppressed and plundered all the days, and there is no saviour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `A woman thou dost betroth, and another man doth lie with her; a house thou dost build, and dost not dwell in it; a vineyard thou dost plant, and dost not make it common;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thine ox [is] slaughtered before thine eyes, and thou dost not eat of it; thine ass [is] taken violently away from before thee, and it is not given back to thee; thy sheep [are] given to thine enemies, and there is no saviour for thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thy sons and thy daughters [are] given to another people, and thine eyes are looking and consuming for them all the day, and thy hand is not to God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fruit of thy ground, and all thy labour, eat up doth a people whom thou hast not known; and thou hast been only oppressed and bruised all the days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast been mad, because of the sight of thine eyes which thou dost see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth smite thee with an evil ulcer, on the knees, and on the legs (of which thou art not able to be healed), from the sole of thy foot even unto thy crown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth cause thee to go, and thy king whom thou raisest up over thee, unto a nation which thou hast not known, thou and thy fathers, and thou hast served there other gods, wood and stone;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast been for an astonishment, for a simile, and for a byword among all the peoples whither Jehovah doth lead thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Much seed thou dost take out into the field, and little thou dost gather in, for the locust doth consume it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: vineyards thou dost plant, and hast laboured, and wine thou dost not drink nor gather, for the worm doth consume it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: olives are to thee in all thy border, and oil thou dost not pour out, for thine olive doth fall off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Sons and daughters thou dost beget, and they are not with thee, for they go into captivity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all thy trees and the fruit of thy ground doth the locust possess;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sojourner who [is] in thy midst goeth up above thee very high, and thou goest down very low;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he doth lend [to] thee, and thou dost not lend [to] him; he is for head, and thou art for tail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And come upon thee have all these curses, and they have pursued thee, and overtaken thee, till thou art destroyed, because thou hast not hearkened to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to keep His commands, and His statutes, which he hath commanded thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have been on thee for a sign and for a wonder, also on thy seed -- to the age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Because that thou hast not served Jehovah thy God with joy, and with gladness of heart, because of the abundance of all things --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou hast served thine enemies, whom Jehovah sendeth against thee, in hunger, and in thirst, and in nakedness, and in lack of all things; and he hath put a yoke of iron on thy neck, till He hath destroyed thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah doth lift up against thee a nation, from afar, from the end of the earth, as the eagle it flieth; a nation whose tongue thou hast not heard,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a nation -- fierce of countenance -- which accepteth not the face of the aged, and the young doth not favour;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath eaten the fruit of thy cattle, and the fruit of thy ground, till thou art destroyed; which leaveth not to thee corn, new wine, and oil, increase of thine oxen, and wealth of thy flock, till it hath destroyed thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath laid siege to thee in all thy gates, till thy walls come down, the high and the fenced ones in which thou art trusting, in all thy land; yea, it hath laid siege to thee in all thy gates, in all thy land, which Jehovah thy God hath given to thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast eaten the fruit of thy body, flesh of thy sons and thy daughters (whom Jehovah thy God hath given to thee), in the siege, and in the straitness with which thine enemies do straiten thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The man who is tender in thee, and who [is] very delicate -- his eye is evil against his brother, and against the wife of his bosom, and against the remnant of his sons whom he leaveth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: against giving to one of them of the flesh of his sons whom he eateth, because he hath nothing left to him, in the siege, and in the straitness with which thine enemy doth straiten thee in all thy gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The tender woman in thee, and the delicate, who hath not tried the sole of her foot to place on the ground because of delicateness and because of tenderness -- her eye is evil against the husband of her bosom, and against her son, and against her daughter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and against her seed which cometh out from between her feet, even against her sons whom she doth bear, for she doth eat them for the lacking of all things in secret, in the siege and in the straitness with which thine enemy doth straiten thee within thy gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If thou dost not observe to do all the words of this law which are written in this book, to fear this honoured and fearful name -- Jehovah thy God --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath Jehovah made wonderful thy strokes, and the strokes of thy seed -- great strokes, and stedfast, and evil sicknesses, and stedfast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And He hath brought back on thee all the diseases of Egypt, of the presence of which thou hast been afraid, and they have cleaved to thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also every sickness and every stroke which is not written in the book of this law; Jehovah doth cause them to go up upon thee till thou art destroyed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have been left with few men, instead of which ye have been as stars of the heavens for multitude, because thou hast not hearkened to the voice of Jehovah thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, as Jehovah hath rejoiced over you to do you good, and to multiply you, so doth Jehovah rejoice over you to destroy you, and to lay you waste; and ye have been pulled away from off the ground whither thou art going in to possess it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah hath scattered thee among all the peoples, from the end of the earth even unto the end of the earth; and thou hast served there other gods which thou hast not known, thou and thy fathers -- wood and stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And among those nations thou dost not rest, yea, there is no resting-place for the sole of thy foot, and Jehovah hath given to thee there a trembling heart, and failing of eyes, and grief of soul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thy life hath been hanging in suspense before thee, and thou hast been afraid by night and by day, and dost not believe in thy life;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the morning thou sayest, O that it were evening! and in the evening thou sayest, O that it were morning! from the fear of thy heart, with which thou art afraid, and from the sight of thine eyes which thou seest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Jehovah hath brought thee back to Egypt with ships, by a way of which I said to thee, Thou dost not add any more to see it, and ye have sold yourselves there to thine enemies, for men-servants and for maid-servants, and there is no buyer.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These [are] the words of the covenant which Jehovah hath commanded Moses to make with the sons of Israel in the land of Moab, apart from the covenant which He made with them in Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses calleth unto all Israel, and saith unto them, `Ye -- ye have seen all that which Jehovah hath done before your eyes in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the great trials which thine eyes have seen, the signs, and those great wonders;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah hath not given to you a heart to know, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, till this day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I cause you to go forty years in a wilderness; your garments have not been consumed from off you, and thy shoe hath not worn away from off thy foot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: bread ye have not eaten, and wine and strong drink ye have not drunk, so that ye know that I [am] Jehovah your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye come in unto this place, and Sihon king of Heshbon -- also Og king of Bashan -- doth come out to meet us, to battle, and we smite them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and take their land, and give it for an inheritance to the Reubenite, and to the Gadite, and to the half of the tribe of Manasseh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have kept the words of this covenant, and done them, so that ye cause all that ye do to prosper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye are standing to-day, all of you, before Jehovah your God -- your heads, your tribes, your elders, and your authorities -- every man of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your infants, your wives, and thy sojourner who [is] in the midst of thy camps, from the hewer of thy wood unto the drawer of thy water --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for thy passing over into the covenant of Jehovah thy God, and into His oath which Jehovah thy God is making with thee to-day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order to establish thee to-day to Him for a people, and He Himself is thy God, as He hath spoken to thee, and as He hath sworn to thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And not with you alone am I making this covenant and this oath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but with him who is here with us, standing to-day before Jehovah our God, and with him who is not here with us to-day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for ye have known how ye dwelt in the land of Egypt, and how we passed by through the midst of the nations which ye have passed by;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye see their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which [are] with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest there be among you a man or woman, or family or tribe, whose heart is turning to-day from Jehovah our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations, lest there be in you a root fruitful of gall and wormwood:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, in his hearing the words of this oath, and he hath blessed himself in his heart, saying, I have peace, though in the stubbornness of my heart I go on, in order to end the fulness with the thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah is not willing to be propitious to him, for then doth the anger of Jehovah smoke, also His zeal, against that man, and lain down on him hath all the oath which is written in this book, and Jehovah hath blotted out his name from under the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah hath separated him for evil, out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the oaths of the covenant which is written in this book of the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the latter generation of your sons who rise after you, and the stranger who cometh in from a land afar off, have said when they have seen the strokes of that land, and its sicknesses which Jehovah hath sent into it, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ([with] brimstone and salt is the whole land burnt, it is not sown, nor doth it shoot up, nor doth there go up on it any herb, like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboim, which Jehovah overturned in His anger, and in His fury,) --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea, all the nations have said, Wherefore hath Jehovah done thus to this land? what the heat of this great anger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And they have said, Because that they have forsaken the covenant of Jehovah, God of their fathers, which He made with them in His bringing them out of the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they go and serve other gods, and bow themselves to them -- gods which they have not known, and which He hath not apportioned to them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the anger of Jehovah burneth against that land, to bring in on it all the reviling that is written in this book,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah doth pluck them from off their ground in anger, and in fury, and in great wrath, and doth cast them unto another land, as [at] this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The things hidden [are] to Jehovah our God, and the things revealed [are] to us and to our sons -- to the age, to do all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, when all these things come upon thee, the blessing and the reviling, which I have set before thee, and thou hast brought [them] back unto thy heart, among all the nations whither Jehovah thy God hath driven thee away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast turned back unto Jehovah thy God, and hearkened to His voice, according to all that I am commanding thee to-day, thou and thy sons, with all thy heart, and with all thy soul --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath Jehovah thy God turned back [to] thy captivity, and pitied thee, yea, He hath turned back and gathered thee out of all the peoples whither Jehovah thy God hath scattered thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If thine outcast is in the extremity of the heavens, thence doth Jehovah thy God gather thee, and thence He doth take thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah thy God hath brought thee in unto the land which thy fathers have possessed, and thou hast inherited it, and He hath done thee good, and multiplied thee above thy fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Jehovah thy God hath circumcised thy heart, and the heart of thy seed, to love Jehovah thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, for the sake of thy life;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah thy God hath put all this oath on thine enemies, and on those hating thee, who have pursued thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou dost turn back, and hast hearkened to the voice of Jehovah, and hast done all His commands which I am commanding thee to-day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah thy God hath made thee abundant in every work of thy hand, in the fruit of thy body, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of thy ground, for good; for Jehovah turneth back to rejoice over thee for good, as He rejoiced over thy fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for thou dost hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God, to keep His commands, and His statutes, which are written in the book of this law, for thou turnest back unto Jehovah thy God, with all thy heart, and with all thy soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator
