verses.text: `For this command which I am commanding thee to-day, it is not too wonderful for thee, nor [is] it far off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not in the heavens, -- saying, Who doth go up for us into the heavens, and doth take it for us, and doth cause us to hear it -- that we may do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it [is] not beyond the sea, -- saying, Who doth pass over for us beyond the sea, and doth take it for us, and doth cause us to hear it -- that we may do it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For very near unto thee is the word, in thy mouth, and in thy heart -- to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `See, I have set before thee to-day life and good, and death and evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in that I am commanding thee to-day to love Jehovah thy God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commands, and His statutes, and His judgments; and thou hast lived and multiplied, and Jehovah thy God hath blessed thee in the land whither thou art going in to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if thy heart doth turn, and thou dost not hearken, and hast been driven away, and hast bowed thyself to other gods, and served them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have declared to you this day, that ye do certainly perish, ye do not prolong days on the ground which thou art passing over the Jordan to go in thither to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `I have caused to testify against you to-day the heavens and the earth; life and death I have set before thee, the blessing and the reviling; and thou hast fixed on life, so that thou dost live, thou and thy seed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to love Jehovah thy God, to hearken to His voice, and to cleave to Him (for He [is] thy life, and the length of thy days), to dwell on the ground which Jehovah hath sworn to thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give to them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth and speaketh these words unto all Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith unto them, `A son of a hundred and twenty years [am] I to-day; I am not able any more to go out and to come in, and Jehovah hath said unto me, Thou dost not pass over this Jordan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Jehovah thy God He is passing over before thee, He doth destroy these nations from before thee, and thou hast possessed them; Joshua -- he is passing over before thee as Jehovah hath spoken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah hath done to them as he hath done to Sihon and to Og, kings of the Amorite, and to their land, whom He destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah hath given them before your face, and ye have done to them according to all the command which I have commanded you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be strong and courageous, fear not, nor be terrified because of them, for Jehovah thy God [is] He who is going with thee; He doth not fail thee nor forsake thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses calleth for Joshua, and saith unto him before the eyes of all Israel, `Be strong and courageous, for thou -- thou dost go in with this people unto the land which Jehovah hath sworn to their fathers to give to them, and thou -- thou dost cause them to inherit it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah [is] He who is going before thee, He himself is with thee; He doth not fail thee nor forsake thee; fear not, nor be affrighted.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses writeth this law, and giveth it unto the priests (sons of Levi, those bearing the ark of the covenant of Jehovah), and unto all the elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses commandeth them, saying, `At the end of seven years, in the appointed time, the year of release, in the feast of booths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the coming in of all Israel to see the face of Jehovah in the place which He chooseth, thou dost proclaim this law before all Israel, in their ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Assemble the people, the men, and the women, and the infants, and thy sojourner who [is] within thy gates, so that they hear, and so that they learn, and have feared Jehovah your God, and observed to do all the words of this law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their sons, who have not known, do hear, and have learned to fear Jehovah your God all the days which ye are living on the ground whither ye are passing over the Jordan to possess it.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Lo, thy days have drawn near to die; call Joshua, and station yourselves in the tent of meeting, and I charge him;' and Moses goeth -- Joshua also -- and they station themselves in the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah is seen in the tent, in a pillar of a cloud; and the pillar of the cloud standeth at the opening of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Lo, thou art lying down with thy fathers, and this people hath risen, and gone a-whoring after the gods of the stranger of the land into the midst of which it hath entered, and forsaken Me, and broken My covenant which I made with it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mine anger hath burned against it in that day, and I have forsaken them, and hidden My face from them, and it hath been for consumption, and many evils and distresses have found it, and it hath said in that day, Is it not because that my God is not in my midst -- these evils have found me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I certainly hide My face in that day for all the evil which it hath done, for it hath turned unto other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, write for you this song, and teach it the sons of Israel; put it in their mouths, so that this song is to Me for a witness against the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I bring them in unto the ground which I have sworn to their fathers -- flowing with milk and honey, and they have eaten, and been satisfied, and been fat, and have turned unto other gods, and they have served them, and despised Me, and broken My covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, when many evils and distresses do meet it, that this song hath testified to its face for a witness; for it is not forgotten out of the mouth of its seed, for I have known its imagining which it is doing to-day, before I bring them in unto the land of which I have sworn.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses writeth this song on that day, and doth teach it the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He commandeth Joshua son of Nun, and saith, `Be strong and courageous, for thou dost bring in the sons of Israel unto the land which I have sworn to them, and I -- I am with thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, when Moses finisheth to write the words of this law on a book till their completion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Moses commandeth the Levites bearing the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Take this Book of the Law, and thou hast set it on the side of the ark of the covenant of Jehovah your God, and it hath been there against thee for a witness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I -- I have known thy rebellion, and thy stiff neck; lo, in my being yet alive with you to-day, rebellious ye have been with Jehovah, and also surely after my death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Assemble unto me all the elders of your tribes, and your authorities, and I speak in their ears these words, and cause to testify against them the heavens and the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have known that after my death ye do very corruptly, and have turned aside out of the way which I commanded you, and evil hath met you in the latter end of the days, because ye do the evil thing in the eyes of Jehovah, to make Him angry with the work of your hands.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses speaketh in the ears of all the assembly of Israel the words of this song, till their completion: --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Give ear, O heavens, and I speak; And thou dost hear, O earth, sayings of my mouth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Drop as rain doth My doctrine; Flow as dew doth My sayings; As storms on the tender grass, And as showers on the herb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Name of Jehovah I proclaim, Ascribe ye greatness to our God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Rock! -- perfect [is] His work, For all His ways [are] just; God of stedfastness, and without iniquity: Righteous and upright [is] He.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It hath done corruptly to Him; Their blemish is not His sons', A generation perverse and crooked!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Jehovah do ye act thus, O people foolish and not wise? Is not He thy father -- thy possessor? He made thee, and doth establish thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember days of old -- Understand the years of many generations -- Ask thy father, and he doth tell thee; Thine elders, and they say to thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Most High causing nations to inherit, In His separating sons of Adam -- He setteth up the borders of the peoples By the number of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jehovah's portion [is] His people, Jacob [is] the line of His inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He findeth him in a land -- a desert, And in a void -- a howling wilderness, He turneth him round -- He causeth him to understand -- He keepeth him as the apple of His eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As an eagle waketh up its nest, Over its young ones fluttereth, Spreadeth its wings -- taketh them, Beareth them on its pinions; --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah alone doth lead him, And there is no strange god with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He maketh him ride on high places of earth, And he eateth increase of the fields, And He maketh him suck honey from a rock, And oil out of the flint of a rock;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Butter of the herd, and milk of the flock, With fat of lambs, and rams, sons of Bashan, And he-goats, with fat of kidneys of wheat; And of the blood of the grape thou dost drink wine!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jeshurun waxeth fat, and doth kick: Thou hast been fat -- thou hast been thick, Thou hast been covered. And he leaveth God who made him, And dishonoureth the Rock of his salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They make Him zealous with strangers, With abominations they make Him angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sacrifice to demons -- no god! Gods they have not known -- New ones -- from the vicinity they came; Not feared them have your fathers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Rock that begat thee thou forgettest, And neglectest God who formeth thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah seeth and despiseth -- For the provocation of His sons and His daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He saith: I hide My face from them, I see what [is] their latter end; For a froward generation [are] they, Sons in whom is no stedfastness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have made Me zealous by `no-god,' They made Me angry by their vanities; And I make them zealous by `no-people,' By a foolish nation I make them angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a fire hath been kindled in Mine anger, And it burneth unto Sheol -- the lowest, And consumeth earth and its increase, And setteth on fire foundations of mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gather upon them evils, Mine arrows I consume upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Exhausted by famine, And consumed by heat, and bitter destruction. And the teeth of beasts I send upon them, With poison of fearful things of the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Without bereave doth the sword, And at the inner-chambers -- fear, Both youth and virgin, Suckling with man of grey hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have said: I blow them away, I cause their remembrance to cease from man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If not -- the anger of an enemy I fear, Lest their adversaries know -- Lest they say, Our hand is high, And Jehovah hath not wrought all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a nation lost to counsels [are] they, And there is no understanding in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they were wise -- They deal wisely [with] this; They attend to their latter end:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How doth one pursue a thousand, And two cause a myriad to flee! If not -- that their rock hath sold them, And Jehovah hath shut them up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For not as our Rock [is] their rock, (And our enemies [are] judges!)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For of the vine of Sodom their vine [is], And of the fields of Gomorrah; Their grapes [are] grapes of gall -- They have bitter clusters;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poison of dragons [is] their wine And the fierce venom of asps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not laid up with Me? Sealed among My treasures?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mine [are] vengeance and recompense, At the due time -- doth their foot slide; For near is a day of their calamity, And haste do things prepared for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jehovah doth judge His people, And for His servants doth repent Himself. For He seeth -- the going away of power, And none is restrained and left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He hath said, Where [are] their gods -- The rock in which they trusted;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which the fat of their sacrifices do eat, They drink the wine of their libation! Let them arise and help you, Let it be for you a hiding-place!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See ye, now, that I -- I [am] He, And there is no god with Me: I put to death, and I keep alive; I have smitten, and I heal; And there is not from My hand a deliverer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I lift up unto the heavens My hand, And have said, I live -- to the age!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I have sharpened the brightness of My sword, And My hand doth lay hold on judgment, I turn back vengeance to Mine adversaries, And to those hating Me -- I repay!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I make drunk Mine arrows with blood, And My sword devoureth flesh, From the blood of the pierced and captive, From the head of the freemen of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing ye nations -- [with] his people, For the blood of His servants He avengeth, And vengeance He turneth back on His adversaries, And hath pardoned His land -- His people.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses cometh and speaketh all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he and Hoshea son of Nun;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses finisheth to speak all these words unto all Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saith unto them, `Set your heart to all the words which I am testifying against you to-day, that ye command your sons to observe to do all the words of this law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it [is] not a vain thing for you, for it [is] your life, and by this thing ye prolong days on the ground whither ye are passing over the Jordan to possess it.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, in this self-same day, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Go up unto this mount Abarim, mount Nebo, which [is] in the land of Moab, which [is] on the front of Jericho, and see the land of Canaan which I am giving to the sons of Israel for a possession;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and die in the mount whither thou art going up, and be gathered unto thy people, as Aaron thy brother hath died in the mount Hor, and is gathered unto his people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Because ye trespassed against me in the midst of the sons of Israel at the waters of Meribath-Kadesh, the wilderness of Zin -- because ye sanctified Me not in the midst of the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but over-against thou seest the land, and thither thou dost not go in, unto the land which I am giving to the sons of Israel.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this [is] the blessing [with] which Moses the man of God blessed the sons of Israel before his death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith: -- `Jehovah from Sinai hath come, And hath risen from Seir for them; He hath shone from mount Paran, And hath come [with] myriads of holy ones; At His right hand [are] springs for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also He [is] loving the peoples; All His holy ones [are] in thy hand, And they -- they sat down at thy foot, [Each] He lifteth up at thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A law hath Moses commanded us, A possession of the assembly of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he is in Jeshurun king, In the heads of the people gathering together, The tribes of Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Reuben live, and not die, And let his men be a number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this [is] for Judah; and he saith: -- Hear, O Jehovah, the voice of Judah, And unto his people do Thou bring him in; His hand hath striven for him, And an help from his adversaries art Thou.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Levi he said: -- Thy Thummim and thy Urim [are] for thy pious one, Whom Thou hast tried in Massah, Thou dost strive with Him at the waters of Meribah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is saying of his father and his mother, I have not seen him; And his brethren he hath not discerned, And his sons he hath not known; For they have observed Thy saying, And Thy covenant they keep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They teach Thy judgments to Jacob, And Thy law to Israel; They put perfume in Thy nose, And whole burnt-offering on Thine altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bless, O Jehovah, his strength, And the work of his hands Thou acceptest, Smite the loins of his withstanders, And of those hating him -- that they rise not!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Benjamin he said: -- The beloved of Jehovah doth tabernacle confidently by him, Covering him over all the day; Yea, between his shoulders He doth tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Joseph he said: -- Blessed of Jehovah [is] his land, By precious things of the heavens, By dew, and by the deep crouching beneath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by precious things -- fruits of the sun, And by precious things -- cast forth by the moons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by chief things -- of the ancient mountains, And by precious things -- of the age-during heights,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by precious things -- of earth and its fulness, And the good pleasure Of Him who is dwelling in the bush, -- Let it come for the head of Joseph, And for the crown of him Who is separate from his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His honour [is] a firstling of his ox, And his horns [are] horns of a reem; By them peoples he doth push together To the ends of earth; And they [are] the myriads of Ephraim, And they [are] the thousands of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Zebulun he said: -- Rejoice, O Zebulun, in thy going out, And, O Issachar, in thy tents;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peoples [to] the mountain they call, There they sacrifice righteous sacrifices; For the abundance of the seas they suck, And hidden things hidden in the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Gad he said: -- Blessed of the Enlarger [is] Gad, As a lioness he doth tabernacle, And hath torn the arm -- also the crown!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he provideth the first part for himself, For there the portion of the lawgiver is covered, And he cometh [with] the heads of the people; The righteousness of Jehovah he hath done, And His judgments with Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Dan he said: -- Dan [is] a lion's whelp; he doth leap from Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Naphtali he said: -- O Naphtali, satisfied with pleasure, And full of the blessing of Jehovah, West and south possess thou.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of Asher he said: -- Blessed with sons [is] Asher, Let him be accepted by his brethren, And dipping in oil his foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iron and brass [are] thy shoes, And as thy days -- thy strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is none like the God of Jeshurun, Riding the heavens in thy help, And in His excellency the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A habitation [is] the eternal God, And beneath [are] arms age-during. And He casteth out from thy presence the enemy, and saith, `Destroy!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel doth tabernacle [in] confidence alone; The eye of Jacob [is] unto a land of corn and wine; Also His heavens drop down dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O thy happiness, O Israel! who is like thee? A people saved by Jehovah, The shield of thy help, And He who [is] the sword of thine excellency: And thine enemies are subdued for thee, And thou on their high places dost tread.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth up from the plains of Moab unto mount Nebo, the top of Pisgah, which [is] on the front of Jericho, and Jehovah sheweth him all the land -- Gilead unto Dan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim, and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah unto the further sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the south, and the circuit of the valley of Jericho, the city of palms, unto Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto him, `This [is] the land which I have sworn to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, To thy seed I give it; I have caused thee to see with thine eyes, and thither thou dost not pass over.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses, servant of the Lord, dieth there, in the land of Moab, according to the command of Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He burieth him in a valley in the land of Moab, over-against Beth-Peor, and no man hath known his burying place unto this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses [is] a son of a hundred and twenty years when he dieth; his eye hath not become dim, nor hath his moisture fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel bewail Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days; and the days of weeping [and] mourning for Moses are completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua son of Nun is full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands upon him, and the sons of Israel hearken unto him, and do as Jehovah commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there hath not arisen a prophet any more in Israel like Moses, whom Jehovah hath known face unto face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in reference to all the signs and the wonders which Jehovah sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in reference to all the strong hand, and to all the great fear which Moses did before the eyes of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
